SEARCH

Class Management

java.lang.Object
Management
public class Management extends Object
The Management class represents a system for managing vehicles and users. It provides functionalities to add, remove, and manipulate vehicles and users.

  • Constructor Summary

    Management()
    Constructs a Management object.

  • Constructor Details

    • Management

      public Management()
      Constructs a Management object. Initializes empty lists of vehicles and users, and sets the currently logged-in user to null. Upon creation, it loads existing user data from a file and populates the users list. Additionally, it loads existing vehicle data from a file and populates the vehicles list.

      Creates and adds a new user to the list.
      Parameters:
      uname - the username of the new user
      pword - the password of the new user

      Returns:

    • listAllVehicles

      public void listAllVehicles()
      Prints all vehicles in the vehicle list to the console.

    • createVehicle

      public void createVehicle(String makeModel, String quality, int seats, int rentalPrice, boolean available)
      Creates a new vehicle and adds it to the list of vehicles.
      Parameters:
      makeModel - the make and model of the vehicle.
      quality - the quality of the vehicle.
      seats - the number of seats in the vehicle.
      rentalPrice - the rental price per day.
      available - the availability status of the vehicle.

    • getVehicles

      public ArrayList<Vehicle> getVehicles()

    • loadVehicles

      public static ArrayList<Vehicle> loadVehicles(String filePath)
      Loads vehicles from a specified file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file from which vehicles are loaded.
      Returns:
      a list of loaded vehicles.

    • rentalPrice

      public int rentalPrice(Date date1, Date date2, Vehicle vehicle)
      Calculates the total rental price based on the start and end dates and the daily rental price of the vehicle.
      Parameters:
      date1 - The start date of the rental period.
      date2 - The end date of the rental period.
      vehicle - The vehicle being rented.
      Returns:
      The total rental price.

    • rentVehicle

      public String rentVehicle(Date date1, Date date2, Vehicle vehicle, int budGet)
      Rents a vehicle if it is available, marking it as unavailable and printing the rental details.
      Parameters:
      date1 - The start date of the rental period.
      date2 - The end date of the rental period.
      vehicle - The vehicle to rent.

    • sortByPriceHighLow

      public ArrayList<Vehicle> sortByPriceHighLow()
      Sorts the list of vehicles by rental price in descending order (high to low).
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of vehicles sorted by price from highest to lowest.

    • sortByPriceLowHigh

      public ArrayList<Vehicle> sortByPriceLowHigh()
      Sorts the list of vehicles by rental price in ascending order (low to high).
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of vehicles sorted by price from lowest to highest.

    • sortBySizeLargestSmall

      public ArrayList<Vehicle> sortBySizeLargestSmall()
      Sorts the list of vehicles by the number of seats in descending order (largest to smallest).
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of vehicles sorted by the number of seats from most to fewest.

    • sortBySizeSmallLargest

      public ArrayList<Vehicle> sortBySizeSmallLargest()
      Sorts the list of vehicles by the number of seats in ascending order (smallest to largest).
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of vehicles sorted by the number of seats from fewest to most.

    • sortBy

      public void sortBy(String sortBy, String quality)
      Sorts the list of vehicles based on the specified criteria.
      Parameters:
      sortBy - The criterion to sort by (e.g., "PriceHighLow", "PriceLowHigh", "SizeLargestSmall", "SizeSmallLargest").
      quality - A filter to apply based on the quality (not used in current implementation).

    • findAdmin

      public boolean findAdmin(String uname)
      Checks if a specified username belongs to an admin user.
      Parameters:
      uname - The username to check.
      Returns:
      true if the user with the given username has admin privileges, false otherwise.
